tabTitle[1]list[1]itemTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the first desktop feature – Page layout on the portal – we will explore the arrangement of visual elements, a crucial aspect that influences the structure and user experience of the desktop application. We'll cover key components such as the site header, footer, main and right sidebars, and main content area, emphasizing the importance of intuitive navigation. Additionally, we'll highlight special functionalities like clickable logos, external links opening in new tabs, and admin capabilities for managing content sections and acting as a regular user.
tabTitle[1]list[1]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[2]itemTitle[1]: Page layout on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the first feature, we will take a look at the general sections, header section, user profile section and the left vertical menu as an admin user, as well as how admin users can act as regular users by switching between admin and user view.
tabTitle[1]list[2]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Page layout on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[3]itemTitle[1]: Maintain navigation on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the second desktop feature – Maintain navigation on the portal – we will explore the navigation menu on the left side of every Sports Hub site page and what items it consists of, namely Home, News pages, Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video and Team hub. We’ll cover categories that have subcategories (for example, the NFL sports category) and those which are static (Lifestyle, Dealbook, Video, and Team hub). Additionally, we'll view how an admin user can configure the navigation menu categories, subcategories, and teams.
tabTitle[1]list[3]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Maintain navigation on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[4]itemTitle[1]: Maintain navigation on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the second feature, we will take a look at what configuration options do the admin users have over the navigation on the Sports Hub portal: how they can create navigation menu items, show or hide them from the user, and change their order or move between categories. We’ll also look at how admin users can add a new team, edit/delete existing teams and filter the Teams page.
tabTitle[1]list[4]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Maintain navigation on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[5]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up to the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the third desktop feature – Log in and sign up to the portal – we will explore how admin users can log in using the seeded data and restore the password using the "Forgot password?" functionality.
tabTitle[1]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up to the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[6]itemTitle[1]: Log in and sign up to the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the third feature, we will take a look at how to create a script to seed admin data to the database (to create an admin account), how admin users can log in with an email and password, and how they can reset their password.
tabTitle[1]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Log in and sign up to the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[7]itemTitle[1]: Site languages on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the fourth desktop feature – Site languages on the portal – we will explore a drop-down list with available languages, how admin users can configure the list of available languages, and how they can use the language selector to change the language of the site content.
tabTitle[1]list[7]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site languages on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[8]itemTitle[1]: Site languages on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourth feature, we will take a look at how admin users can configure site languages on the portal and configure content in multiple languages. We’ll also look at how admin users and site users can change the site language.
tabTitle[1]list[8]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site languages on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[9]itemTitle[1]: Manage articles on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the fifth desktop feature – Manage articles on the portal – we will explore how admin users can manage the articles, namely add new articles, view/edit/delete existing ones, publish or unpublish articles, change their category and turn the comments on or off.
tabTitle[1]list[9]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage articles on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[10]itemTitle[1]: Manage articles on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifth feature, we will take a look at how admin users can add new articles, view the list of existing articles per category and edit/publish/unpublish/move/delete an existing article. We’ll also look at the advanced image editing options of an admin user: how they can update/delete/crop/resize an image and apply filters to it.
tabTitle[1]list[10]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage articles on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[11]itemTitle[1]: Home page of the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the sixth desktop feature – Home page of the portal – we will explore the main page of the Sports Hub site, which contains the most recent news and topics. We will learn how to configure the home page sections, such as Main articles, Breakdown, and Photo of the day.
tabTitle[1]list[11]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page of the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[12]itemTitle[1]: Home page of the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixth feature, we will cover how an admin user can configure 3 sections of the Home page, namely the Main articles, Breakdown, and Photo of the day sections, as well as how they can preview the changes made to those sections without saving them.
tabTitle[1]list[12]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Home page of the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[13]itemTitle[1]: Social networks on the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the seventh desktop feature – Social networks on the portal – we will explore how admis can configure the available social networks on the portal.
tabTitle[1]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Social networks on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventh feature, we will cover how admins can configure which social networks can be used to share/follow Sports Hub and sign up/log in to the portal.
tabTitle[1]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Social networks on the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[15]itemTitle[1]: Site footer of the portal - overview
tabTitle[1]list[15]videoDescription[1]: In the eighth desktop feature – Site footer of the portal – we will explore the footer section, which is configured by the admin, and its three columns: Company info, Contributors, Newsletter, as well as the Sports Hub logo, the copyright sign, and the Privacy and Terms links. Additionally, we’ll see what links should be present in the Company info and Contributors columns.
tabTitle[1]list[15]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site footer of the portal:
tabTitle[1]list[16]itemTitle[1]: Site footer of the portal - user stories
tabTitle[1]list[16]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eighth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the footer sections (links and content).
tabTitle[1]list[16]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Site footer of the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[1]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[1]videoDescription[1]: In the ninth desktop feature – The most popular and commented articles on the portal – we will explore the Most popular and Most commented sections that contain most popular and most commented articles on the portal. Additionally, we will see what configuration options does an admin have over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[1]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[2]itemTitle[1]: The most popular and commented articles on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[2]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the ninth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Most popular and Most commented sections.
tabTitle[2]list[2]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - The most popular and commented articles on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[3]videoDescription[1]: In the tenth desktop feature – Lifestyle and Dealbook news – we will explore the news from Lifestyle and Dealbook section. The Lifestyle section contains news about the daily life of sports stars and teams, and the Dealbook section is about financial deals in the sports world, such as transfer of players and rewards. Additionally, we will see what configuration options an admin has over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[3]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[4]itemTitle[1]: Lifestyle and Dealbook news - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[4]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the tenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Lifestyle and Dealbook sections (add new articles, edit/delete existing articles, etc.).
tabTitle[2]list[4]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Lifestyle and Dealbook news:
tabTitle[2]list[5]itemTitle[1]: Sports videos on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[5]videoDescription[1]: In the eleventh desktop feature – Sports videos on the portal – we will explore the Video menu item on the left-side men, that should contain videos, including most popular and most commented ones. Additionally, we will see what configuration options an admin has over these sections.
tabTitle[2]list[5]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Sports videos on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[6]itemTitle[1]: Sports videos on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[6]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the eleventh feature, we will cover how admins can add new videos and view/publish/unpublish/edit/delete existing ones.
tabTitle[2]list[6]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Sports videos on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[7]itemTitle[1]: Manage news partners on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[7]videoDescription[1]: In the twelfth desktop feature – Manage news partners on the portal – we will explore how admins can configure new partners, view existing partners’ configurations and edit the existing partners’ configurations, as well as how they can edit articles from the news partner and process/publish these articles.
tabTitle[2]list[7]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage news partners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[8]itemTitle[1]: Manage news partners on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[8]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the twelfth feature, we will cover how admins can configure partners on the portal (activate/deactivate existing partners), edit/delete/filter/process news from partners and see the processed articles on the articles list page.
tabTitle[2]list[8]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage news partners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[9]videoDescription[1]: In the thirteenth desktop feature – Newsletter subscription – we will explore how admin users can configure the Newsletter footer section.
tabTitle[2]list[10]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the thirteenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the Newsletter footer section, and how users can subscribe to the Sports Hub site to receive an email with the latest sports news.
tabTitle[2]list[11]itemTitle[1]: User management on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[11]videoDescription[1]: In the fourteenth desktop feature – User management on the portal – we will explore how admins can review and manage a list of users. Additionally, we will look at what actions an admin has over the user accounts.
tabTitle[2]list[11]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - User management on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[12]itemTitle[1]: User management on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[12]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fourteenth feature, we will cover how admins can view the list of viewers on the portal, block/activate/delete user accounts, give/remove admin permissions, see their status/details, search them by name and filter them based on certain criteria.
tabTitle[2]list[12]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - User management on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[13]videoDescription[1]: In the fifteenth desktop feature – Banners on the portal – we will explore the banners that should be related to the category that the user is viewing. Additionally, we will look at the predefined banners and what configuration options an admin user has over the banners.
tabTitle[2]list[13]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[14]itemTitle[1]: Banners on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[14]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the fifteenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure normal and predefined banners on the portal.
tabTitle[2]list[14]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Banners on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[15]itemTitle[1]: Manage advertisements on the portal - overview
tabTitle[2]list[15]videoDescription[1]: In the sixteenth desktop feature – Manage advertisements on the portal – we will explore advertisements (category-related and site-wide), that should be at the top of the right sidebar of the site and which should redirect the user to the advertised website when they click on it. Additionally, we will see what configuration options an admin has over the advertisements.
tabTitle[2]list[15]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage advertisements on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[16]itemTitle[1]: Manage advertisements on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[16]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the sixteenth feature, we will cover how admins can configure the list of advertisements.
tabTitle[2]list[16]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Manage advertisements on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[17]videoDescription[1]: In the seventeenth desktop feature – Surveys on the portal – we will explore surveys, that help collect information from sports fans and build statistics. Additionally, we’ll see what configuration options an admin has over the surveys.
tabTitle[2]list[17]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Surveys on the portal:
tabTitle[2]list[18]itemTitle[1]: Surveys on the portal - user stories
tabTitle[2]list[18]videoDescription[1]: In the video analyzing the user stories of the seventeenth feature, we will cover how admins can create/publish/close/filter surveys on the portal.
tabTitle[2]list[18]labelLink[1]: Sports Hub - Surveys on the portal:
